div.div:
Dear Harlan Co Families:
We are committed to keeping you up-to-date on any developments related to COVID-19 in our community. We remain in close collaboration with the Harlan County Health Department and our local government to ensure a unified response to this public health issue.
On behalf of all of our staff members, we have truly missed having your children present at school. We are all looking forward to a return to our normal routines and the opportunity to resume regularly scheduled classes. In compliance with directives from both Governor Beshear and Education Commissioner Brown, Harlan County Schools will remain closed through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year with a closing day for students of May 14th, 2020. Based on the May 14th closing date, our teachers are being asked to create nine (9) additional NTI/CDL packets. These additional packets are for the 9 school days which occur after May 1st. We already have NTI/CDL packets in place through May 1st.
As school closure has become an appropriate mitigation measure, we have prepared action plans to provide grade-appropriate educational activities and learning experiences for students as well as meal delivery and pickup options at our local schools. Please review the letters below to find additional guidance and updates:
- March 13, 2020: CDL Letter and Guidance
- March 24, 2020: Letter to Families & Updates
Both digital and hard copies will be available for student assignments on Covid Distance Learning days. All lessons can be picked up at the front desk of each school or delivered to the home along regular bus route stops. As instructors develop and choose to make assignments available on the HCPS website, they will be posted below along with contact information for each of the schools and Family Resource & Youth Service Centers.
Announcements
- Spring Sports Cancellation, Basketball Events Not To Be Resumed
CDL Due Dates for Assignments
- March 16th - May 1st

li.a: Google Resources for Teleconferencing and Remote Classroom

br.br: A child's ideas about education and its significance begin with the parent and for students to achieve at a high level, parents must play an active role in the educational processes of their children.
